avdta.project

Class Project

  • java.lang.Object
    • avdta.project.Project
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    TransitProject

    public abstract class Project
extends java.lang.Object
    This abstract class represents any project that contains a network (which most do). It defines an API for accessing network data files. A project is intended to represent a network scenario. Changes to the network are best handled by creating a clone of the current project. Projects may be cloned by copying the project folder or by invoking the API. Project subclasses add APIs for accessing additional files needed by other project types. Working with Projects usually involves the following: create a Project subclass with the desired directory. Then, access the Simulator via getSimulator().

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructs an empty Project

      Loads a project from the specified directory.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Project

        public Project()
        Constructs an empty Project

      • Project

        public Project(java.io.File dir)
        throws java.io.IOException
        Loads a project from the specified directory. This does not read the associated Simulator. getSimulator() will call loadProject() if necessary.
        Parameters:
        dir - The should be the project directory, not one of the project data files
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if the file is not found

      • sanityCheck

        public int sanityCheck()
        Performs a sanity check on the network input data. Calls sanityCheck(java.io.PrintStream) with getSanityCheckFile(), and prints any errors to that file.
        Returns:
        the number of errors found

      • sanityCheck

        public int sanityCheck(java.io.PrintStream fileout)
        Performs a sanity check on the network input data. Calls ReadNetwork.sanityCheck(avdta.project.Project, java.io.PrintStream).
        Parameters:
        fileout - the PrintStream to print errors to.
        Returns:
        the number of errors found
